DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Patient Tobacco Use Questionnaire 5 Average Number Cigarettes Smoked a Day Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of the average number of cigarettes they smoke or smoked per day.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cancer Patient Tobacco Use Questionnaire Average Number Cigarettes Smoked a Day
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire developed for the baseline and longitudinal assessment of tobacco use in the cancer setting. Domains include cigarette smoking history and current use, use relative to cancer diagnosis and treatment, other tobacco product use, cessation, and second-hand exposure._A question about the average number of cigarettes an individual smoked or smokes in one day.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire developed for the baseline and longitudinal assessment of tobacco use in the cancer setting. Domains include cigarette smoking history and current use, use relative to cancer diagnosis and treatment, other tobacco product use, cessation, and second-hand exposure.

Concepts.definition: A questionnaire developed for the baseline and longitudinal assessment of tobacco use in the cancer setting. Domains include cigarette smoking history and current use, use relative to cancer diagnosis and treatment, other tobacco product use, cessation, and second-hand exposure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: information related to the average numeric count of something.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The central tendency of a set of n numbers; lacking special distinction, rank, or status; commonly encountered.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: A statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers; used to interpret quantitative data.
Determining the number or amount of something.

ReferenceDocuments.name: On average when you have smok
ReferenceDocuments.description: On average when you have smoked, about how many cigarettes do you (or did you) smoke a day?

ReferenceDocuments.name: A pack usually has 20 cigarettes in it.
ReferenceDocuments.description: A pack usually has 20 cigarettes in it.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value sets in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these CDEs.
